bioghist.p: Joseph Pennell (1857-1926) was born in Philadelphia. Pennell studied at the Philadelphia Industrial Art School and at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts. After 1883, Pennell spent a great deal of his time traveling and working in Europe, using London as his home base, until in 1917, he returned to the United States to live. He produced numerous books (many of them in collaboration with his wife, Elizabeth Robins Pennell), but his chief distinction is as an original etcher and lithographer, and notably as an illustrator.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of lithographs, etchings, and drawings by Joseph Pennell. Lithographs include views of Philadelphia, including city streets, and interior and exteriors of Cliveden and Stenton. Pen and ink drawings include early studies and sketches; several illustrations for The Century; and the title page for Elizabeth Robins Pennell's Over the Alps on a Bicycle. There are a number of views of industrial work sites, including shipyards, locomotive works, and a munitions factory; there are also several views of airfields. The collection also includes "Views on the Old Germantown Road," a set of 16 etchings published in 1880.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
